title: Meridian man arrested after fatal shooting
content:
According to Meridian Police, officers responded to a call of a possible suicide in the 2300 block of East Franklin Road, but later gathered information from witnesses that the shooting was not a suicide. After talking to people at the home, officers determined several people were smoking marijuana and drinking alcohol in the room where the shooting happened.
David Provencio, 18, was handling one of two handguns in the room, when he pointed the gun, which he thought was unloaded, at the victim and pulled the trigger, according to police.
There were at least two other adults and several children home at the time of the shooting, police said.
Provencio was booked into the Ada County jail on the charge of involuntary manslaughter.
